column4: random question about partitions (for a default ubuntu install) - why is it that the swap partition is sitting inside of an extended partition?  can you make the swap partition one of the 4 primary partitions?  or does it have to be extended...
is there some reason that ubuntu sets it up to not be primary?  what's the motivation
i think that's just how the autopartioner is set up... me i always use manual. (not real familiar with it)
